Method Detail

addParameter

public void addParameter(java.lang.String value,
                         Query.ParameterType parameterType)
public void addParameter(String value, ParameterType parameterType)

Adds new parameter

example: select * from table where column1 = ? and column2 = ?;

Parameters are replacing those '?' while connector will create prepared statement.

The order is from left to right.

Parameters:
value -
parameterType -

setRegexPattern

public static void setRegexPattern(java.lang.String regexPattern)

Change default regex pattern into your own pattern.

Parameters:
regexPattern -

isThisStringLigalAccordingToRegexPattern

public static boolean isThisStringLigalAccordingToRegexPattern(java.lang.String query)
Using Regex to check if input characters are legal in given query.

I strongly suggest to use your own pattern

(use setRegexPattern(...) method to do so).

By Default Allows: [^a-z0-9 %|'|;|*|,|.|_|=|(|)|:|?|/|!|[|]|+|\"|{|}|$|@|?-?|^\\s*$]

Parameters:
query -
Returns:
true if query string legal according to given regex (see default regex on setRegexPattern(..) method).
